title: Item sets quotes, for visibility.
body:
If all you want to do is explore the items without being in game, you can do that in the website.
http://gameinfo.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/game-info/items/

Quotes:

TL;DR Item sets is not something we'll be working on at the moment, if ever. You can still modify your item sets by using the old client or a third party tool like Championify.

1.

> 
> Well, you can still customize them using third party tools like Championify‚Äîwe just don't have any plans to implement the item set builder feature from the old client.
> 
> If it turns out that there actually is real demand for that tool, we can reconsider it, of course. But on our great big list of client priorities (implement Replays, spectate, etc.), it would probably fall dead last right now.
> 
> Just wanted to give y'all an honest heads up.
> 
http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/alpha-client-discussion/xYiHismR?show=flat&comment=00010000

2.

> 
> If you used the item set maker, I feel your pain.
> 
> But hear us out here: this is ultimately a dev priorities thing. When fewer than 1% of players use a thing, you can safely say it's a lower priority than other things. And there's a TON of features above it on our list‚Äîso many that we likely won't get around to it during Open Beta or possibly ever, if people are happy with our support of 3rd-party options.
> 
> Again, we're listening to your feedback. We're gonna keep supporting third parties, but if that isn't enough, we'll reconsider.
> 
http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/alpha-client-discussion/xYiHismR?show=flat&comment=0001000000000000

3.

> 
> For those of you who rely on 3rd party tools, like Championify or LSI, to add your item sets... these will still work!
> 
> There is actually a difference, on a technological level, between the Custom Items that are created using the client UI elements, and the custom items that are created by 3rd party tools. The technical underpinnings for those tools will remain (they are related to the core game, not the client) when the client side stuff is phased out.
> 
http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/alpha-client-discussion/xYiHismR?show=flat&comment=00010002

4.

> 
> Unfortunately that lies outside my scope. Personally I was not part of the decision making process to have to cut this feature for the reasons they outlined, no the discussions around the solution focusing on 3rd parties.
> 
> That said, I personal rely heavily on Champion.gg myself, and have solid confidence in it's reliability given how closely my team has worked in the past with it's creator. (It also helps all his code is open and public on git hub for security review)
> 
http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/alpha-client-discussion/xYiHismR?show=flat&comment=0001000200030000

replies.body:
I use Item sets. I have used them for two years now. And now this is just annoying. You change support items all the freaking time, and now I can't even change the damage you did. Instead I get to use either
a) recommended sets
b) the ones I made earlier (with either items missing or changed)
OR
c) I get to spend too much time in pool wondering where are the items I want to buy.

Atm I am trying to play somewhere between option B and C.

I also have some friends who use item sets. I got about 100-110 friends in my list. So if that is a good take of 'normal, average group of players', then more than 1% actually use item sets.

I'd recommend checking out [Championify](https://github.com/dustinblackman/Championify/releases/latest) if you haven't already. It basically pulls recommended builds from websites like champion.gg right into your game so you don't have to keep updating your item sets.

EDIT: Just a suggestion in case people haven't heard about it. I'm aware that it doesn't replace item sets, just shamelessly plugging a program I like. :S

>  so you don't have to keep updating your item sets.

Really?  This doesn't count.  Updating builds and creating them yourself is 90% of the reason anyone uses them.  Championify might work for you meta sheep, but it doesn't cut it for me.
that's nice and all but I like to organize my item sets certain ways with different options, plus I always add in vision/control wards to my sets etc so they're right there

This was the best way to ensure that i get the right starting items for my selected champ, role or ingame progress.

Now I constantly purchase incorrect starting items (I don't wanna stick to the meta like a brain dead zombie to merely follow the recommended build path, and searching for items wastes so much inlane time, XP and gold income.

I also constantly forget to swap my warding trinket for the required {{item:3341}} , {{item:3364}} or {{item:3363}} depending on my role, since it is not right there (in front of me as it used to be)

If anything, it was so *badly* implemented that like chromas, "nobody" used it.

Not only they were a pain to make, but as well as being shoved in a tiny little corner that "nobody" noticed. It's not a matter of "nobody wants it", but rather, "nobody uses it because they don't even know it exists".

I'll add in how shit bugs all the time so their hard work of building a page gets lost overnight, so that also contributes to why "nobody" uses it anymore.

to be fair the reason ppl stop using the item sets was because when riot first instroduce the feature, they got erase after each patch, so those that could have use the tool saw their work destroy and didnt bother to use it anymore

is a good tool that helps you alot specially in a game where new weird pick show up every time, *cough* miss fortune support *cough*

100% why I stopped rather quickly.

I remade my page for Morg (I play her a lot) about 4 times. It got reset everytime for a good few patches there.

I near instantly just said "fuck it" and didn't bother ever again. There was no point when it just got reset. As much as I WANTED to use it, I got tired of remaking it over and over again.
For fuck's sake Riot, STOP DELETING FUNCTIONALITIES.

I guess this goes back to my earlier comment of; if features are visible to the public and people are able to vote on them (from their client) you would have a real number of people who actually would use something like this. Without knowing what other features are ahead of it, it's hard to say if people would really want the development of this tool to be greater than something else.

Well that's a big fuck you to all of the players who care enough about the game to actually use **all** of the features the client has to offer.  If you don't bring item sets with the new client, you might as well not have a store either, because I don't plan on spending money on a game that cares so little about its playerbase.

WTH

I can't believe so few people use this feature, its so nice. consider me one more person that hopes you'll reconsider keeping it. I mean, jesus, was it even a difficult feature to add?

So riot what are we going to do if we want to make a non-meta build? Are you going to update the old client forever so that we can continue to make item sets in it? Do you think it's fair to the player-base to make them have to exit game, open the old client, fix a build, go back to the new client, try it out, and back for adjustments every time? 

Being a person that changes at least 3 item sets a day, and has an item set for each champion and their position, I can tell you this pisses me off. I started doing item sets because I couldn't remember what items were best for each champion, and in cases of champions like Warwick, the recommended item set was terrible, and other cases my play style for a champion didn't fit any item set I could find. 

Anyways unless you're using a completely new programming language, it shouldn't be too hard to implement the old item set maker in the new client, it shouldn't be any harder than runes or masteries. Also where are you getting these statistics of 1%? Is this only counting for high ranked players, because most players I have on my friends list (I am unranked) have item sets.
Try playing champs like Morgana, Karma or Sona mid (you get support items in the recommended). Vel'Koz support doesn't recommend Support items, it recommend Mage midlane items...

Decided to come back to the League Of Legends for a fresh season after a year out, and all was well (kinda :B) until THAT! Bummer...

So I looked into this forum and so far, there's still like 5% of the hot topics that are asking for the item sets feature to return.
And guys, when you see a [near-thousand upvoted](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/aWRfq6Ze-petition-to-keep-item-sets) topic and [several](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/VIWXPOOA-only-a-tiny-percentage-of-players-use-item-sets-so-we-are-not-bringing-it-to-the-new-client) [others](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/42KFomzO-were-currently-not-planning-to-bring-over-the-item-set-creator-feature-from-the-legacy-client) [with](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/QgritzQM-the-reason-only-a-small-percentage-of-people-use-item-sets-is-because-theyre-a-bitch-to-make) [hundreds](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/cO2uIHHj-an-in-depth-look-at-keeping-item-sets) [of upvotes](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/alpha-client-discussion/6fE9iLFb-there-are-no-item-sets-in-the-alpha-client) on that matter, all being highly discussed, I guess you can at least question the relevance of your data Riot... Or how you interpreted it I should say.
It is clear that the feature needs more love rather than total abandonment... We count on you!

DO IT! JUST DO IT!!!
{{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}
{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}  Tu Che.  Give me the link to these 100 upvote blogs, and I'm sure to go upvote them aswell

> [{quoted}](name=Riot a huevo,realm=NA,application-id=2E4zVIwd,discussion-id=TM2LphEf,comment-id=,timestamp=2016-11-10T14:05:02.656+0000)
>
> If all you want to do is explore the items without being in game, you can do that in the website.
> http://gameinfo.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/game-info/items/

No, we can't, you haven't updated it yet.

I have a general question.  You state that we can use third party programs like Championify.  However, 3rd party programs are against the ToS.  Are they not?

How am I supposed to know which programs are allowable and which are not?
I find myself paranoid that I will get randomly banned due to a poor detection algorithm or a 180 on Riot's stance on 3rd party programs (or any one in particular)?
Why can I not even just edit the ItemSets.json file in the ...\Config\ItemSets.json file to get those changes updated in the alpha client?  Why do I have to change individual itemsets for each champion (and then again whenever a new one comes out)?

I think the border between right and wrong in third parties for Riot is if it affects directly the in game experience, and not the client/config stuff...

For the json modification, as Item sets are now kept server-side by Riot, there is a risk a manual modification would be overwritten by item set sync...

Okay, So what you're saying is that i can't create an itemset page for the optimal builds for my champion? 
I mostly play {{champion:10}} and her builds change drastically between patches. 

Another good example, is my Fiora itemset: http://prntscr.com/d6imd4
I like to differ a bit from Riot's official item sets, and generally have some variablility. 2x Starting items, Trinkets + Upgrades (If an upgrade is good / suggested)
Core: 2 Core items, + 300 gold boots + Pink + Elixir
Damage: Offensive items
Defense: Defensive items  / Utility. 

I do these for people on twitter and help them out with their choices. (Champion.gg and championify aren't always the best)

If you do decide to go through with this route, can you please consider keeping legacy client support only for itemsets only (Don't allow us to enter games with it.) I don't really want to download third party programs, due to having a bad history with them. (Plays.Tv / Raptr / LolReplay have situational issues with my ping and cause client crashing.) Also, not only that but riot has a huge "grey area" on what's legal from third party sites, and i wouldn't want to get banned for using a program just for its itemsets feature because it has another function that might mess with gameplay imputs. 

Please reconsider this choice, ùìúùìÆùìΩùì™ ‚úò

We can't ask for them to keep it in the legacy client because that's a trap. At some point, they will no longer update the legacy client, so you would just be extending your doom. We have to lobby for it's inclusion in the new client or at some point the feature will just cease to exist.
